page.title: 17SHILLINGFORD-CONSERVATION
page.content: THE WHOLE AREA IS VERY AWARE OF THE NEED FOR CONSERVATION. FARMERS ARE LEAVING SMALL AREAS OF WOODLAND UNCULTIVATED.THEY ARE NOT CUTTING HEDGEROWS BACK SEVERLY AND BEING CAREFUL IN THE USE OF INSECTISIDES. THE WHOLE AREA IS NATURAL HABITAT FOR MANY SPECIES OF MAMMALS,INSECTS,BIRDS,REPTILES AND ANFIBEANS.WE SAW DEER,RODENTS,MANY SPECIES OF BUTTERFLIES AND MOTHS AND BIRDS. A SMALL FARM RESERVOIR WAS VISITED BY CANADIAN GEESE,HERONS,SWAN,DUCKS,DOVES AND BUZZARDS HAVE BEEN SEEN IN THE AREA. THE PEACE AND TRANQUILITY OF THE AREA, LACK OF POPULATION AND NOT BEING A MAJOR TOURIST AREA HAS ENABLED PLANTS AND ANIMALS TO FLORISH WHICH ARE ENDANGERED IN MOST OF THE COUNTRY.
